project_description: The Flutter application is a course management system that allows users to view a list of available courses, add new courses, and interact with course-related features. The application provides a clean and intuitive user interface and follows the Stacked architecture, which promotes a clear separation of concerns between business logic, UI, and state management.
architecture_overview: The application's architecture is based on the Stacked pattern, which provides a clean separation of concerns. The main components include ViewModels (e.g., HomeViewModel, StartupViewModel, CoursesViewModel) that handle the business logic and state management, Views (e.g., HomeView, StartupView, CoursesView) that represent the UI, and a centralized Service Locator (app.locator.dart) that manages the application's dependencies. The app also utilizes the Stacked Router (app.router.dart) for navigation and routing between different screens, as well as the Stacked Services (DialogService, BottomSheetService) for handling custom UI components.

files.name: lib/app/app.dart
files.description: Defines the app structure using StackedApp annotation for routes, dependencies, bottom sheets, and dialogs. It includes routes (HomeView, StartupView), services (BottomSheetService, DialogService, NavigationService), bottom sheets (NoticeSheet), and dialogs (InfoAlertDialog). The file structure allows for easy addition of new services, routes, bottom sheets, and dialogs using the @stacked-import, @stacked-route, @stacked-service, @stacked-bottom-sheet, and @stacked-dialog annotations.

files.description: The main home view of the application.

files.name: lib/features/home/home_viewmodel.dart
files.description: ViewModel for the HomeView, manages the state and business logic.

methods.description: Increments the counter value

methods.name: showDialog
methods.description: Shows a custom dialog

methods.name: showBottomSheet

files.description: The startup view shown when the app is first launched.

files.description: ViewModel for the StartupView, handles initialization logic.

files.name: lib/config/production/firebase_options_production.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for configuring the Firebase SDK for the production environment of the application. It provides the necessary information for the app to connect to the correct Firebase project and services.

files.name: lib/app/app.dialogs.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for setting up the dialog UI for the application. It defines a central location for managing and registering custom dialog builders, which helps to decouple the dialog implementation from the rest of the application.

methods.name: setupDialogUi
methods.description: This function sets up the dialog UI by registering custom dialog builders with the DialogService. It maps each DialogType to its corresponding dialog builder, which is responsible for rendering the appropriate dialog UI.

files.name: lib/app/app.bottomsheets.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for setting up and configuring the bottom sheet UI in the application. It defines the different types of bottom sheets that can be displayed and provides a central location for registering their builders.

methods.name: setupBottomSheetUi
methods.description: Sets up the bottom sheet service with custom builders for each bottom sheet type.

files.name: lib/services/analytic_service.dart
files.description: The AnalyticService class is a wrapper for handling analytics-related functionality in the application. It acts as an abstraction layer, encapsulating the implementation details of the analytics service and providing a consistent interface for other parts of the application to interact with.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the AnalyticService, preparing it for use.

files.name: lib/app/app.router.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for managing the navigation and routing within the Flutter application. It defines the available routes, their corresponding views, and provides utility methods to navigate between these views.

methods.name: navigateToHomeView
methods.description: Navigates to the HomeView route.

methods.name: navigateToStartupView
methods.description: Navigates to the StartupView route.

methods.name: replaceWithHomeView
methods.description: Replaces the current route with the HomeView route.

methods.name: replaceWithStartupView
methods.description: Replaces the current route with the StartupView route.

files.name: lib/services/course_service.dart
files.description: The CourseService class is responsible for managing the lifecycle of courses in the application. It provides the core functionality for fetching, creating, updating, and deleting courses, acting as a bridge between the UI and the underlying data repository.

methods.name: getCourses
methods.description: Retrieves the list of all courses from the repository.

methods.name: addCourse
methods.description: Adds a new course to the repository.

methods.name: removeCourse
methods.description: Removes a course from the repository by its ID.

methods.name: updateCourse
methods.description: Updates an existing course in the repository.

methods.name: getCourseById
methods.description: Retrieves a course from the repository by its ID.

files.name: lib/features/courses/widgets/add_course_form.dart
files.description: The `AddCourseForm` widget is responsible for providing a form interface that allows users to input details about a new course, such as the course name, professor, schedule, credits, and description. This form is used to create a new `Course` object, which can then be submitted to the application for storage or further processing.

methods.name: createState
methods.description: Creates the state object for the `AddCourseForm` widget.

methods.name: _submitForm
methods.description: Validates the form fields and creates a new `Course` object with the user-provided data. The `onSubmit` callback is then called with the new `Course` object, and the form is closed.

files.name: lib/ui/dialogs/info_alert/info_alert_dialog.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines the `InfoAlertDialog` class, which is responsible for displaying an information alert dialog in the application's user interface. The dialog is used to convey important information to the user, such as updates, notifications, or instructions.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: The main build method that constructs the visual elements of the information alert dialog. It takes the dialog request, view model, and optional child widget as parameters and returns the final widget tree.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: Provides an instance of the `InfoAlertDialogModel` to be used as the view model for the dialog.

files.name: lib/ui/common/app_colors.dart
files.description: This file defines a set of constant color values that are used throughout the application's user interface. It provides a centralized location for managing the application's color palette, making it easier to maintain a consistent visual style across different screens and components.

files.name: lib/ui/dialogs/info_alert/info_alert_dialog_model.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines the `InfoAlertDialogModel` class, which is responsible for managing the state and behavior of an information alert dialog in a Flutter application.

files.name: lib/ui/bottom_sheets/notice/notice_sheet_model.dart
files.description: The `NoticeSheetModel` class is responsible for managing the state and behavior of the notice bottom sheet UI component in the application. It is a view model that extends the `BaseViewModel` class from the `stacked` package, which provides a foundation for implementing the MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) architectural pattern.

files.name: lib/app/app.locator.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for setting up the dependency injection and service locator for the application. It is a core part of the application's architecture, providing a central registry for all the services and dependencies used throughout the codebase.

methods.name: setupLocator
methods.description: This method is responsible for registering the various services and dependencies that the application uses. It sets up the StackedLocator instance, which acts as the central service registry.

files.name: lib/ui/bottom_sheets/notice/notice_sheet.dart
files.description: The `NoticeSheet` class is responsible for rendering a reusable bottom sheet UI component that displays a notice or alert message to the user. It is part of the UI layer of the application and is used to present important information or updates to the user in a clear and visually appealing way.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: The `builder` method is responsible for constructing the UI of the `NoticeSheet` widget. It takes the current `BuildContext`, the `NoticeSheetModel` instance, and an optional child widget as parameters, and returns the final widget tree to be rendered.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: The `viewModelBuilder` method is responsible for creating an instance of the `NoticeSheetModel` class, which is used to manage the state and logic of the `NoticeSheet` widget.

files.name: lib/ui/common/ui_helpers.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides a set of reusable UI helper functions and constants that can be used across the Flutter application. It aims to establish a consistent and responsive user interface by providing standardized spacing, font sizes, and screen size utilities.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml

class UIHelpers {
  +static final horizontalSpaceTiny: Widget
  +static final horizontalSpaceSmall: Widget
  +static final horizontalSpaceMedium: Widget
  +static final horizontalSpaceLarge: Widget
  +static final verticalSpaceTiny: Widget
  +static final verticalSpaceSmall: Widget
  +static final verticalSpaceMedium: Widget
  +static final verticalSpaceLarge: Widget
  +static final verticalSpaceMassive: Widget
  +static Widget spacedDivider
  +static Widget verticalSpace(double height)
  +static double screenWidth(BuildContext context)
  +static double screenHeight(BuildContext context)
  +static double screenHeightFraction(BuildContext context, {int dividedBy = 1, double offsetBy = 0, double max = 3000})
  +static double screenWidthFraction(BuildContext context, {int dividedBy = 1, double offsetBy = 0, double max = 3000})
  +static double halfScreenWidth(BuildContext context)
  +static double thirdScreenWidth(BuildContext context)
  +static double quarterScreenWidth(BuildContext context)
  +static double getResponsiveHorizontalSpaceMedium(BuildContext context)
  +static double getResponsiveSmallFontSize(BuildContext context)
  +static double getResponsiveMediumFontSize(BuildContext context)
  +static double getResponsiveLargeFontSize(BuildContext context)
  +static double getResponsiveExtraLargeFontSize(BuildContext context)
  +static double getResponsiveMassiveFontSize(BuildContext context)
  +static double getResponsiveFontSize(BuildContext context, {double? fontSize, double? max})
}

@enduml

methods.name: screenWidth
methods.description: Returns the width of the screen in the current BuildContext.

methods.name: screenHeight
methods.description: Returns the height of the screen in the current BuildContext.

methods.name: screenHeightFraction
methods.description: Returns a fraction of the screen height, optionally with an offset and maximum value.

methods.name: screenWidthFraction
methods.description: Returns a fraction of the screen width, optionally with an offset and maximum value.

methods.name: halfScreenWidth
methods.description: Returns half the width of the screen.

methods.name: thirdScreenWidth
methods.description: Returns one-third the width of the screen.

methods.name: quarterScreenWidth
methods.description: Returns one-quarter the width of the screen.

methods.name: getResponsiveHorizontalSpaceMedium
methods.description: Returns a responsive horizontal spacing value, adjusted for the screen width.

methods.name: getResponsiveSmallFontSize
methods.description: Returns a responsive small font size, adjusted for the screen width.

methods.name: getResponsiveMediumFontSize
methods.description: Returns a responsive medium font size, adjusted for the screen width.

methods.name: getResponsiveLargeFontSize
methods.description: Returns a responsive large font size, adjusted for the screen width.

methods.name: getResponsiveExtraLargeFontSize
methods.description: Returns a responsive extra-large font size, adjusted for the screen width.

methods.name: getResponsiveMassiveFontSize
methods.description: Returns a responsive massive font size, adjusted for the screen width.

methods.name: getResponsiveFontSize
methods.description: Returns a responsive font size, adjusted for the screen width, with an optional maximum value.

files.name: lib/ui/views/app/app_view.dart

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the application's main UI, including the MaterialApp, navigation, and other core UI components.

files.name: lib/ui/views/home/home_view.dart

methods.name: builder
methods.description: Builds the UI for the home screen, including a counter, a button to increment the counter, and buttons to show a dialog and a bottom sheet.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: Constructs the `HomeViewModel` instance that drives the business logic for the home screen.

files.name: lib/ui/views/home/home_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The HomeViewModel class is responsible for managing the state and logic related to the home screen of the application. It provides functionality for incrementing a counter, displaying a dialog, and showing a bottom sheet.

methods.name: incrementCounter
methods.description: Increments the counter and rebuilds the UI to reflect the new value.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.description: Displays a custom dialog with a title, description, and a variant of DialogType.infoAlert.

methods.name: showBottomSheet
methods.description: Displays a custom bottom sheet with a title, description, and a variant of BottomSheetType.notice.

files.name: lib/ui/views/startup/startup_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The `StartupViewModel` class is responsible for handling the initial startup logic and navigation of the application. It is part of the MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) architecture used in the application, where it represents the ViewModel component.

methods.name: runStartupLogic
methods.description: This method encapsulates the startup logic for the application. It is responsible for performing any necessary initialization or setup tasks before the main application is loaded. In this case, it simply delays for 3 seconds and then navigates to the home view of the application.

files.name: lib/utils/contact/contact_util.dart
files.description: The `ContactUtil` class provides a set of utility functions for interacting with contacts, such as launching WhatsApp and sending emails. It abstracts away the platform-specific details and provides a simple, cross-platform API for these common contact-related actions.

methods.name: launchWhatsApp
methods.description: Launches the WhatsApp application and initiates a conversation with the specified phone number. Optionally, a text message can be included.

methods.name: launchEmail
methods.description: Launches the default email application and creates a new email message with the specified email address.

files.name: lib/utils/exceptions/api_exception.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines an exception class, `APIException`, that is used to handle and propagate errors that occur in the API service layer of the application.

methods.name: APIException
methods.description: The constructor for the `APIException` class. It takes an optional `message` parameter, which can be any dynamic value, and stores it in the `message` field.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: The `toString` method overrides the default implementation to provide a string representation of the `APIException` object, which includes the runtime type and the `message` value.

files.name: lib/utils/const/const.dart
files.description: This Dart file contains a set of constant variables that define various application-wide configurations and settings. It serves as a centralized location for storing and managing common constants used throughout the application.

files.name: lib/utils/extensions/color_extension.dart
files.description: The `color_extension.dart` file provides a utility extension on the `Color` class in Flutter, allowing for easy conversion of hexadecimal color codes to `Color` objects. This extension simplifies the process of working with colors in the application, making it more efficient to define and use consistent color schemes.

methods.name: fromHex
methods.description: Converts a hexadecimal color code string to a `Color` object. The input string can be with or without the leading '#' character, and the function will handle both cases.

methods.name: intFromHex
methods.description: Converts a hexadecimal color code string to an integer value representing the color. The input string can be with or without the leading '#' character, and the function will handle both cases.

files.name: lib/utils/json/json_util.dart
files.description: The `JsonUtil` class provides utility functions for working with JSON data in the application. It is responsible for handling common JSON-related tasks, such as formatting maps, safely converting JSON to Dart objects, and formatting lists of JSON maps.

methods.name: formatMap
methods.description: Formats a dynamic JSON map to a strongly-typed `Map<String, dynamic>`.

methods.name: fromJsonOrNull
methods.description: Safely converts a dynamic JSON value to a Dart object of type `T`, or returns `null` if the input is invalid.

methods.name: formatListMap
methods.description: Formats a list of dynamic JSON maps to a list of Dart objects of type `T`.

files.name: lib/utils/flavors/flavors.dart
files.description: This file defines a utility class `Flavors` that is responsible for managing and storing the current app flavor (development, production, etc.). It provides a simple interface for checking the current flavor and determining if the app is running in a development or production environment.

methods.name: Flavors
methods.description: Private constructor for the Flavors class, used to ensure a singleton instance.

methods.name: factory Flavors
methods.description: Factory constructor that returns the singleton instance of the Flavors class.

methods.name: isDev
methods.description: Getter that returns true if the current app flavor is Flavor.development.

methods.name: isProd
methods.description: Getter that returns true if the current app flavor is Flavor.production.

files.name: lib/utils/date/date_util.dart
files.description: The DateUtil class provides utility functions for working with date and time data, particularly for handling different date/time representations used in the application.

methods.name: fromJson
methods.description: Converts a dynamic value (which could be a Timestamp, String, or DateTime) into a DateTime object.

files.name: lib/ui/views/startup/startup_view.dart
files.description: The `StartupView` class is responsible for displaying the initial startup screen of the application. It provides a visually appealing and informative UI to the user while the application is loading and initializing.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: Provides an instance of the `StartupViewModel` to be used by the `StartupView`.

files.name: lib/models/enums/flavor.dart

files.name: lib/config/development/firebase_options_development.dart

files.class_diagram:
```plantuml
class FirebaseOptions {
  final String apiKey
  final String appId
  final String messagingSenderId
  final String projectId
  final String storageBucket
}
```

methods.name: firebase_options_development
methods.description: This method returns the FirebaseOptions instance with the necessary configuration for the development environment.

files.name: lib/observer/screen_observer.dart
files.description: The ScreenObserver is responsible for tracking the screen views of the application using an AnalyticService. It acts as a NavigatorObserver to intercept navigation events and record the corresponding screen views.

methods.name: didPush
methods.description: Called when a new route is pushed onto the Navigator.

methods.name: didReplace
methods.description: Called when a route is replaced with a new route.

methods.name: didPop
methods.description: Called when a route is popped off the Navigator.

methods.name: _trackScreenView
methods.description: Tracks the screen view using the AnalyticService.

files.name: lib/models/course.dart
files.description: The `Course` class in this file represents a university course, encapsulating its key information such as the course ID, name, professor, schedule, credits, and description. It provides a data model for managing course-related data in the application.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class Course {
  -String id
  -String name
  -String professor
  -String schedule
  -int credits
  -String description
  +Course({required id, required name, required professor, required schedule, required credits, required description})
  +copyWith({id, name, professor, schedule, credits, description})
  +toJson(): Map<String, dynamic>
  +fromJson(Map<String, dynamic>): Course
  +get props: List<Object?>
}
@enduml

methods.name: Course
methods.description: The constructor for the `Course` class, which initializes the course's properties.

methods.name: copyWith
methods.description: Creates a new `Course` instance with the specified properties updated, allowing for partial updates.

methods.name: toJson
methods.description: Converts the `Course` object into a JSON-serializable Map.

methods.name: fromJson
methods.description: Constructs a `Course` object from a JSON Map.

methods.name: props
methods.description: Returns a list of the course's properties, used for equality comparison and hashing.

files.name: lib/l10n/supported_locales.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines the supported locales and localization delegates for the application. It is responsible for managing the internationalization and localization of the app, ensuring that the user interface and content can be displayed in multiple languages.

methods.name: localizationsDelegates
methods.description: Returns the list of localization delegates used by the app. These delegates are responsible for loading the appropriate language-specific resources.

methods.name: supportedLocales
methods.description: Returns the list of locales supported by the app. This determines the languages that the user can select from to view the app's content.

files.name: lib/features/courses/courses_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The CoursesViewModel class is responsible for managing the state and functionality related to courses in the application. It serves as the view model for the courses feature, providing an abstraction layer between the UI and the underlying data and services.

methods.name: get courses
methods.description: Returns the list of courses managed by the CoursesViewModel.

methods.name: addCourse
methods.description: Adds a new course to the list of courses managed by the CoursesViewModel.

methods.name: removeCourse
methods.description: Removes a course from the list of courses managed by the CoursesViewModel.

files.name: lib/l10n/localizations_extension.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides a convenient extension on the `BuildContext` class that simplifies access to the current `AppLocalizations` instance, which is responsible for managing the localization and internationalization of the application's user interface.

methods.name: get localizations
methods.description: Retrieves the current `AppLocalizations` instance associated with the `BuildContext`. This is a convenient way to access the localization functionality without having to call `AppLocalizations.of(context)` directly.

files.name: lib/main/main_production.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for bootstrapping the main production application view, the `AppView`, using the `bootstrap` function from `main/bootstrap.dart`. It sets the application flavor to 'production' and initializes the app with the necessary setup.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The main entry point of the application. It calls the `bootstrap` function with the `AppView` as the builder and sets the application flavor to 'production'.

files.name: lib/main/bootstrap.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for bootstrapping the Flutter application. It sets up the initial application configuration, including the app's flavor, dependency injection, and custom UI components like dialogs and bottom sheets. The main purpose of this file is to provide a centralized and consistent way to initialize the app and ensure a smooth startup process.

methods.name: bootstrap
methods.description: The main entry point for bootstrapping the application. It sets up the app's flavor, initializes the dependency injection, sets up custom UI components, and runs the app with the provided builder function.

files.name: lib/ui/views/app/app_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The `AppViewModel` class is responsible for managing the state and behavior of the application's main view. It is a part of the MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) architectural pattern used in the Flutter application.

files.name: lib/l10n/l10n.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for managing the localization and internationalization (i18n) functionality of the application. It serves as a centralized hub for accessing and handling localized app resources, ensuring a consistent and multilingual user experience.

files.name: lib/features/courses/widgets/course_card.dart
files.description: This file defines a `CourseCard` widget, which is responsible for displaying the details of a single course in a user-friendly card layout. It is a key component in the application's course management feature, providing a visual representation of the course information.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the visual representation of the `CourseCard` widget, including the course name, professor, schedule, and credits. It also provides a delete button to allow the user to remove the course.

files.name: lib/features/courses/courses_view.dart
files.description: The CoursesView class is responsible for displaying a list of courses and providing functionality to add new courses. It acts as the main UI component for the courses feature in the application.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the UI for the CoursesView, including the app bar, floating action button, and the list of courses.

files.name: lib/features/courses/course_repository.dart
files.description: The CourseRepository class is responsible for managing the CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for courses in the application. It serves as the central data access point for the courses feature, providing a consistent and reliable way to interact with the course data.

methods.name: getCourses
methods.description: Retrieves a list of all courses, returning an unmodifiable copy.

methods.name: addCourse
methods.description: Adds a new course to the list of courses.

methods.name: removeCourse
methods.description: Removes a course from the list of courses by its ID.

methods.name: updateCourse
methods.description: Updates an existing course in the list of courses.

methods.name: getCourseById

files.name: lib/main/main_development.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for bootstrapping the development version of the application. It sets up the initial state and configuration for the app, and launches the main UI component.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The entry point of the application. It calls the `bootstrap` function to initialize the app with the `AppView` as the root widget and the `Flavor.development` configuration.

files.name: lib/features/auth/widgets/auth_text_field.dart
files.description: The AuthTextField widget is responsible for providing a custom text input field for authentication-related screens in the application. It handles the presentation and validation of text input, catered specifically for authentication use cases.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the AuthTextField widget, which includes a label, a TextFormField with customized decoration and behavior, and optional validation.

files.name: lib/features/auth/widgets/auth_button.dart
files.description: The AuthButton widget is a custom Flutter button component that provides a consistent and visually appealing login/signup button across the application's authentication screens. It handles the loading state, allowing for a smooth user experience while waiting for an authentication operation to complete.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the AuthButton widget, which is a SizedBox containing an ElevatedButton. The button displays either a loading spinner or the provided text, depending on the value of the isLoading flag.

files.name: lib/features/auth/register_view.dart
files.description: The RegisterView class is responsible for rendering the user interface for the registration process in the application. It provides a form for users to enter their name, email, and password, and a button to submit the registration request.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the UI for the registration form, including input fields for name, email, and password, as well as a register button and a link to the login page.

files.name: lib/features/auth/login_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The LoginViewModel class is responsible for managing the login functionality of the application. It provides a centralized place to handle user authentication, including validating user input, interacting with the AuthRepository to perform the login, and managing the application navigation.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class LoginViewModel {
  - final _authRepository: AuthRepository
  - final _navigationService: NavigationService
  - final formKey: GlobalKey<FormState>
  - final emailController: TextEditingController
  - final passwordController: TextEditingController
  + String? validateEmail(String? value)
  + String? validatePassword(String? value)
  + Future<void> login()
  + void navigateToRegister()
  + dispose()
}

LoginViewModel --> AuthRepository
LoginViewModel --> NavigationService
@enduml

methods.name: validateEmail
methods.description: Validates the email input, ensuring it is not empty and is in a valid email format.

methods.name: validatePassword
methods.description: Validates the password input, ensuring it is not empty and is at least 6 characters long.

methods.name: login
methods.description: Handles the login process, including validating the form, interacting with the AuthRepository to perform the login, and navigating to the home view upon successful login.

methods.name: navigateToRegister
methods.description: Navigates the user to the register view.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Disposes of the email and password controllers when the view model is no longer needed.

files.name: lib/features/auth/login_view.dart
files.description: The LoginView class is responsible for providing the user interface for the login functionality of the application. It allows users to enter their email and password, and then handles the login process by interacting with the LoginViewModel.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the UI for the login screen, including input fields for email and password, a login button, and a link to the registration screen.

files.name: lib/models/user.dart
files.description: The `User` class in this file represents a user of the application. It encapsulates the core user data, including the user's unique identifier, email, and name. This class serves as a standardized data model for user-related functionality across the application.

methods.name: User.fromJson
methods.description: A factory constructor that creates a `User` instance from a JSON map. This allows for easy deserialization of user data from a data source, such as an API or a database.

methods.name: toJson
methods.description: Converts the `User` instance to a JSON map. This enables easy serialization of user data for storage or transmission, such as sending user data to a backend server.

methods.name: get props
methods.description: Returns a list of the properties that define the equality of a `User` instance. This is used by the `Equatable` mixin to provide a default implementation of `==` and `hashCode`.

files.name: lib/features/auth/auth_repository.dart
files.description: The AuthRepository class is the central component responsible for handling user authentication and authorization within the application. It serves as a bridge between the application's user interface and the underlying authentication services, providing a consistent and reliable way to manage user login, registration, and logout operations.

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs in a user with the provided email and password, returning the authenticated User instance.

methods.name: register
methods.description: Registers a new user with the provided email, password, and name, returning the newly created User instance.

methods.name: logout
methods.description: Logs out the currently authenticated user and clears any session-related data.

methods.name: isAuthenticated
methods.description: Checks if the user is currently authenticated and returns the authentication status.

methods.name: currentUser
methods.description: Provides the currently authenticated User instance, or null if no user is signed in.

files.name: lib/features/auth/register_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The RegisterViewModel class is responsible for handling the registration functionality of the application. It provides the necessary logic and data management to allow users to register a new account with the application.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class RegisterViewModel {
  - _authRepository: AuthRepository
  - _navigationService: NavigationService
  + formKey: GlobalKey<FormState>
  + nameController: TextEditingController
  + emailController: TextEditingController
  + passwordController: TextEditingController
  + validateName(String?): String?
  + validateEmail(String?): String?
  + validatePassword(String?): String?
  + register(): Future<void>
  + navigateToLogin(): void
  + dispose(): void
}
@enduml

methods.name: validateName
methods.description: Validates the user's name input, ensuring it is not empty.

methods.name: validateEmail
methods.description: Validates the user's email input, ensuring it is not empty and is a valid email format.

methods.name: validatePassword
methods.description: Validates the user's password input, ensuring it is not empty and is at least 6 characters long.

methods.name: register
methods.description: Attempts to register the user with the provided name, email, and password. If the form is valid, it calls the AuthRepository to register the user and then navigates to the home view.

methods.name: navigateToLogin
methods.description: Navigates the user to the login view.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Disposes of the text editing controllers to prevent memory leaks.

files.name: lib/services/auth_service.dart
files.description: The AuthService class is responsible for handling user authentication and authorization within the application. It provides functionality for user login, registration, and logout, as well as managing the currently authenticated user's information.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class AuthService implements InitializableDependency {
  - String userKey
  - Client client
  - Account account
  - SharedPreferences _prefs
  - User? _currentUser
  - User? currentUser

  + init()
  + login(String email, String password): Future<User>
  + register(String email, String password, String name): Future<User>
  + logout(): Future<void>
  + isAuthenticated(): bool
  - _loadUserFromPrefs(): Future<void>
  - _saveUserToPrefs(User user): Future<void>
}
@enduml

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the AuthService by setting up the Appwrite client, account, and loading the currently authenticated user from shared preferences.

methods.name: login
methods.description: Authenticates a user with the provided email and password, and saves the user's information to shared preferences.

methods.name: register
methods.description: Registers a new user with the provided email, password, and name, and saves the user's information to shared preferences.

methods.name: logout
methods.description: Logs out the currently authenticated user and removes their information from shared preferences.

methods.name: isAuthenticated
methods.description: Checks if there is a currently authenticated user.

methods.name: _loadUserFromPrefs
methods.description: Loads the currently authenticated user's information from shared preferences.

methods.name: _saveUserToPrefs
methods.description: Saves the currently authenticated user's information to shared preferences.

files.name: lib/ui/theme/app_theme.dart
files.description: This file defines the app's overall theme and styling, including colors, typography, and UI elements like buttons and inputs. It provides a centralized and consistent way to manage the visual design of the application.

methods.name: AppTheme
methods.description: This class is not instantiated directly, but rather serves as a container for the app's theme data.

files.name: lib/ui/shared/input_decorations.dart
files.description: This file defines a set of reusable input field decorations for the application's UI, providing a consistent and visually appealing look and feel across various input fields.

methods.name: defaultInputDecoration
methods.description: Generates a default input field decoration with customizable label text, hint text, prefix icon, and suffix icon.

methods.name: searchInputDecoration
methods.description: Generates a search input field decoration with customizable hint text, prefix icon, and suffix icon.

files.name: lib/ui/shared/card_styles.dart
files.description: This file defines the default styles and decorations for cards used throughout the application's UI. It provides a centralized place to manage and customize the visual appearance of cards, ensuring consistent styling across the application.

methods.name: defaultCardDecoration
methods.description: Provides the default styling for cards, including a white background, rounded corners, and a subtle drop shadow.

methods.name: elevatedCardDecoration
methods.description: Provides the styling for elevated cards, which have a more pronounced drop shadow to create a raised effect.

methods.name: flatCardDecoration
methods.description: Provides the styling for flat cards, which have a white background and a light grey border.

files.name: lib/ui/shared/elevated_button_styles.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines a set of reusable styles for elevated buttons in the Flutter application. It provides a centralized location to manage the appearance and behavior of the application's primary, secondary, and outlined buttons.

methods.name: primaryButton
methods.description: Defines the style for the primary elevated button used throughout the application. This button has a primary color background, white text, no elevation, and rounded corners.

methods.name: secondaryButton
methods.description: Defines the style for the secondary elevated button used throughout the application. This button has a secondary color background, white text, no elevation, and rounded corners.

methods.name: outlinedButton
methods.description: Defines the style for the outlined elevated button used throughout the application. This button has a transparent background, primary color text, no elevation, and a primary color border with rounded corners.

dependencies.name: stacked
dependencies.purpose: Stacked architecture for state management and routing

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant main
participant AppView
participant StartupView
participant StartupViewModel
participant HomeView
participant HomeViewModel
participant CoursesView
participant CoursesViewModel

User -> main: Launch app
main -> AppView: Create and run
AppView -> StartupView: Initialize
StartupView -> StartupViewModel: Run startup logic
StartupViewModel -> HomeView: Navigate to home view
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Initialize
User -> HomeView: Interact (e.g., increment counter, show dialog, show bottom sheet)
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Handle user actions
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Update UI
HomeViewModel -> DialogService: Show dialog
HomeViewModel -> BottomSheetService: Show bottom sheet
User -> CoursesView: Navigate to courses view
CoursesView -> CoursesViewModel: Initialize
CoursesViewModel -> CourseRepository: Fetch courses
CoursesView -> CourseCard: Display course details
User -> CoursesView: Add new course
CoursesView -> AddCourseForm: Show form
AddCourseForm -> CoursesViewModel: Submit new course
CoursesViewModel -> CourseRepository: Add new course
@enduml
state_management_flow: The application uses the Stacked architecture for state management. Each view has a corresponding ViewModel that handles the business logic and state for that view. The ViewModels use observable properties and notifiers to update the UI when the state changes. For example, the HomeViewModel manages the counter value, while the CoursesViewModel manages the list of courses. The app.locator.dart file sets up the dependency injection, allowing the ViewModels to access necessary services and repositories, such as the CourseRepository and DialogService.
navigation_flow: The navigation flow of the application is managed using the Stacked Router, which is defined in the app.router.dart file. The AppView sets up the initial route, which is the StartupView. After the startup logic is completed, the StartupViewModel navigates to the HomeView. From the HomeView, the user can navigate to the CoursesView by clicking a button or menu item. The Stacked Router provides methods for navigating between views, such as `navigateToHomeView` and `navigateToCoursesView`, which are used in the ViewModels to handle navigation actions.
